subprocess_flow.description: The Development Team, Scrum Master, and Product Owner review the prioritized Product Backlog to understand the available user stories, their estimates, and acceptance criteria. This ensures everyone has a shared understanding of the work to be considered for the sprint.
success_criteria: All team members have a clear understanding of the product backlog items.

subprocess_flow.description: The Development Team collaborates with the Product Owner to define a clear and concise Sprint Goal that aligns with the overall product vision and business objectives. The Sprint Goal provides focus and direction for the sprint.
success_criteria: A draft sprint goal is defined.

subprocess_flow.description: The Development Team selects user stories from the Product Backlog that align with the Sprint Goal and can be realistically completed within the sprint timeframe, considering team capacity and velocity. The team discusses dependencies and potential risks associated with each user story.
success_criteria: A set of candidate user stories is selected.

subprocess_flow.description: The Development Team breaks down the selected user stories into smaller, actionable tasks required for implementation. Each task should be clearly defined and estimated in hours.
success_criteria: User stories are broken down into tasks.

subprocess_flow.description: The Development Team estimates the effort required to complete each task in the Sprint Backlog, typically in hours. This ensures that the team has a realistic understanding of the workload for the sprint.
success_criteria: All tasks have effort estimates assigned.

subprocess_flow.description: The Scrum Master verifies that the total estimated effort for all tasks in the Sprint Backlog does not exceed the Development Team's capacity for the sprint, considering any planned time off or other commitments. If the workload is too high, user stories may need to be removed or tasks re-estimated.
success_criteria: Sprint workload aligns with team capacity.

subprocess_flow.description: The Development Team, Product Owner, and Scrum Master finalize the Sprint Backlog, ensuring that it contains all the necessary tasks to achieve the Sprint Goal and that the workload is realistic and achievable. The Sprint Backlog is then committed to by the Development Team.
Document the final Sprint Goal and Sprint Backlog in the project management tool. Make it visible to the entire team and stakeholders, ensuring transparency and alignment.
success_criteria: Sprint plan is documented and visible.
